page.title: 17Farming in Halsall
page.content: We interviewed a Halsall farmer who said his potatoes were sent to Preston and Liverpool markets. He said he had 4 tractors, one combine-harvester, 2 potato-harvesters, 2 cultivators and 3 rotivators. The farm has 385 acres. They have no animals. They grow wheat, barley, corn and carrots. He gets his seed from Scotland. In good weather he gets a low price for potatoes from 40 to 140 pounds per ton and in bad weather he gets up to 400 pounds per ton. Most of the employment in the area is based on farming, with 15 people being employed on one farm and 45 with a seed merchant. Local garages and the public house afford some employment so there is not a local unemployment problem.
